channel.title: Dragon Claw Spec Bar
channel.description:
I've followed a hundred billion guides and in the comments a lot of people are having the same problem as me; the spec bar doesn't show up.
There's got to be some fix for this, I know it's possible to get it working. I've tried adding a few different things in my itemAssistant:
[code] case 11740: //dragon claws c.getPA().sendFrame171(0, 7800); specialAmount(weapon, c.specAmount, 7812); break;[/code] tried adding it in this list too [code] case 1215:// dragon dagger case 1231: case 5680: case 5698: case 1305: // dragon long case 11694: case 11698: case 11700: case 11730: case 11696: case 14484: case 11740: c.getPA().sendFrame171(0, 7574); specialAmount(weapon, c.specAmount, 7586); break; [/code]
and in my combatAssistant: [code] case 4151: case 11694: case 11698: case 4153: case 14484: case 11740: if(c.specAmount >= 5) { c.specAmount -= 5; c.getItems().addSpecialBar(weapon); return true; } return false;[/code]
as far as I can see I'm doing nothing wrong. I hate coming to the help section, but I've spent way too long trying to fix this I simply can't do it by myself.
Thanks for reading.

item.title: Dragon Claw Spec Bar
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

I’ve followed a hundred billion guides and in the comments a lot of people are having the same problem as me; the spec bar doesn’t show up.

There’s got to be some fix for this, I know it’s possible to get it working. I’ve tried adding a few different things in my itemAssistant:

case 11740: //dragon claws c.getPA().sendFrame171(0, 7800); specialAmount(weapon, c.specAmount, 7812); break;
tried adding it in this list too

case 1215:// dragon dagger case 1231: case 5680: case 5698: case 1305: // dragon long case 11694: case 11698: case 11700: case 11730: case 11696: case 14484: case 11740: c.getPA().sendFrame171(0, 7574); specialAmount(weapon, c.specAmount, 7586); break;

and in my combatAssistant:

case 4151: case 11694: case 11698: case 4153: case 14484: case 11740: if(c.specAmount >= 5) { c.specAmount -= 5; c.getItems().addSpecialBar(weapon); return true; } return false;

as far as I can see I’m doing nothing wrong. I hate coming to the help section, but I’ve spent way too long trying to fix this I simply can’t do it by myself.

Thanks for reading.

Read full topic
